newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila foreign exchange market closed for holiday.
newsitem.headline: Manila foreign exchange market closed for holiday.

text.p: * Monday's trend seen dictated by Central Bank
The Philippine foreign exchange market was closed on Friday for a holiday for All Saints Day.
All Saints Day on November 1 and All Souls Day the following day are festivals when Filipinos visit cemeteries to pray for the dead.
On Thursday, the Philippine peso ended a tad lower at 26.285 from 26.284 on arbitrage play for the long weekend.
Traders said the Central Bank was firm at not letting the dollar slip below 26.285 level.
On Monday, in the absence of any developments, the peso will just follow where the Central Bank wants it to be, one trader said. -- UDAY KHANDEPARKAR (632) 841 8934
